main event: The report describes sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) at Holloman AFB, N.M. on 27 April and 24 May 1950. The sightings were made by professional observers and involved tracking the objects using Askania Photoreodolites, and film was taken on both occasions.
interesting points: Sightings were made by professional observers, indicating the reliability of the witnesses.
Photos were taken with Askania Photoreodolites during the sightings.
Objects were observed at an altitude of approximately 150,000 feet, traveling at high speeds, and were around 30 feet in diameter.
The report indicated that the film footage of the sightings was carefully studied and concluded that the objects were genuine and merited continued observation.
The report mentions the difficulty of obtaining good motion picture footage of UFOs due to the ideal observational conditions required and the skill of the cameraman.
